VEC.Q: How many series are represented in this area chart?

SRP.Q: What is the vertical (above/below) relationship of the area representing Fine Dining relative to Street Food Hubs?
SRP.A: Fine Dining is {below} Street Food Hubs in the vertical direction.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the largest portion to the total restaurant reservations?
VPR.A: The series with the largest contribution is {Casual Eateries}.

VPR.Q: Which series contributes the smallest portion to the total restaurant reservations?
VPR.A: The series with the smallest contribution is {Family Restaurants}.

VE.Q: What is Vegan Cafes's Restaurant Reservations in 1998?
VE.A: Vegan Cafes's restaurant reservations in 1998 is {1444.51} reservations/week.

VE.Q: What is Vegan Cafes's Restaurant Reservations in 2002?
VE.A: Vegan Cafes's restaurant reservations in 2002 is {1926.24} reservations/week.

VE.Q: What is Rooftop Bars's Restaurant Reservations in 1991?
VE.A: Rooftop Bars's restaurant reservations in 1991 is {1003.38} reservations/week.

VE.Q: What are the restaurant reservations of Rooftop Bars, Casual Eateries, and Vegan Cafes in 1997?
VE.A: Rooftop Bars's restaurant reservations is {1203.48} reservations/week, Casual Eateries's restaurant reservations is {1976.03} reservations/week, Vegan Cafes's restaurant reservations is {1602.93} reservations/week.

EVJ.Q: What is the global minimum Restaurant Reservations in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global minimum restaurant reservations is {497.86} reservations/week.

EVJ.Q: What is the global maximum Restaurant Reservations in the area chart?
EVJ.A: The global maximum restaurant reservations is {4501.19} reservations/week.

EVJ.Q: What is the highest Restaurant Reservations level recorded for Casual Eateries?
EVJ.A: Casual Eateries reached approximately {4501.19} reservations/week in {2007}.

EVJ.Q: What is the lowest Restaurant Reservations level recorded for Casual Eateries?
EVJ.A: Casual Eateries's lowest recorded level is approximately {987.77} reservations/week in {1991}.

SC.Q: What is the average total Restaurant Reservations?
SC.A: The average total restaurant reservations is {9279.01} reservations/week.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Restaurant Reservations exceed 10143.62 reservations/week? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {12671.92} reservations/week in {2007}, {10698.59} reservations/week in {2002}, {10405.98} reservations/week in {2005}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Restaurant Reservations go below 8020.95 reservations/week? Please list the years and corresponding total values.
NF.A: {7927.23} reservations/week in {1996}, {7444.04} reservations/week in {1991}, {7725.02} reservations/week in {1993}.

NF.Q: Which years did the total Restaurant Reservations fall between 8628.17 and 9536.40 reservations/week? Please list the years and corresponding total values.

NC.Q: Between 1997 and 2006, was the average total Restaurant Reservations higher or lower than between 1999 and 2005?
NC.A: The average total restaurant reservations between 1997 and 2006 was {higher} than between 1999 and 2005.

NC.Q: Between 1991 and 1997, was the average total Restaurant Reservations higher or lower than between 2000 and 2006?
NC.A: The average total restaurant reservations between 1991 and 1997 was {lower} than between 2000 and 2006.

NC.Q: Between 1997 and 2007, was the average total Restaurant Reservations higher or lower than between 1997 and 2003?
NC.A: The average total restaurant reservations between 1997 and 2007 was {higher} than between 1997 and 2003.

NC.Q: Was the total Restaurant Reservations in 1993 higher or lower than in 2007?
NC.A: The total restaurant reservations in 1993 was {lower} than in 2007.

MSR.Q: Which series has the largest cumulative area in this area chart?
MSR.A: {Casual Eateries} has the largest cumulative area.

VA.Q: To reduce the 'waving' visual effect in the area chart, reorder the layers by end value and list the labels from top to bottom after sorting.
VA.A: The reordered layer order from top to bottom is: {Family Restaurants, Fusion Kitchens, Fine Dining, Rooftop Bars, Street Food Hubs, Vegan Cafes, Casual Eateries}.
